data.title: Chicago
data.meta_description: Posse and its partner institutions empower diverse groups of leaders who transform communities, this country and the world.
data.text:
To date, Chicago Scholars have won $350.3 million scholarship dollars from Chicago partner colleges and universities.

History

Founding Board Chair Tim Ubben, a graduate and trustee of DePauw University, spearheaded Posse’s debut in the Windy City. Tim organized a generous group of five benefactors to establish the founding fund for Posse Chicago. The site opened its doors in 2000 with DePauw University, Denison University and Carleton College as its first partner schools.

Tim died in 2021, but his legacy as one of Posse’s most generous and committed stewards lives on.

We are grateful to the teachers, counselors and community leaders of Chicago, who help us identify incredible high school students. We especially thank our partner colleges and universities for their investments in the program and belief in the promise of Posse Scholars.
